name: Network Switching & Routing
description: Sector template for network switching and routing patents including packet switching, routing protocols, and traffic management.
contextDescription: Network switching patents cover core network infrastructure. Key areas include routing (H04L45), packet switching (H04L49), QoS/traffic control (H04L47), SDN, and network virtualization. High-value targets include Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Huawei, cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), and hyperscalers. Data center networking is a particularly high-growth area.
scoringGuidance: Routing protocol patents (BGP, OSPF, MPLS) are foundational for carrier networks.
SDN/OpenFlow patents target cloud and data center modernization.
Data center switching patents (leaf-spine, ECMP) target hyperscalers.
QoS patents are critical for 5G transport and enterprise networks.
Network virtualization (NFV) patents target telcos and cloud providers.

questions.question: What network layer does this patent target? Score: 1-3 for L1/physical, 4-6 for L2/switching, 7-10 for L3+/routing and above.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the OSI layer and network function.

questions.question: How relevant is this to data center networking? Consider hyperscalers, cloud providers, and modern DC architectures.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Data center is the highest growth networking segment. Assess DC applicability.

questions.question: Is this patent relevant to SDN, NFV, or network programmability? Key for network modernization.
questions.reasoningPrompt: SDN/NFV is transforming carrier and enterprise networks.

questions.question: Which major vendors would implement this? Consider Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Huawei, cloud providers.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify specific vendors and their market positions.
